This is a must for the Barnes and Noble Simple Touch Ereader.<n>I bought this item to replace the original charger that I'd lost.<n>I am still missing the USB cable now i can charge my nook anywhere.

Some parts are cute, some are just wierd looking.<n>The people who gave this DVD a good review either live in a cardboard world, or they work for the company who produced this hunk-o-junk!

Easy to install and tilt option but it has to be locked by nuts.<n>The mount was installed level and the first arm is level but second arm is not.<n>You really need (on my unit at least) to work it for a while before installing so you don't have to put so much stress on the mounts once installed.

I purchased this for my 96 year old mother, who loves to read, but her eyesight is not good. But when I received a gift card this spring, I thought, "This is going to be spent on something I wouldn't blow my own money on but

Battery life is amazing and the nook library is defiantly growing.<n>Battery is only consumed when the color screen is on or when pages are turned.<n>The 3G option for the NOOK is a waste of money unless you want to buy books directly from public libraries.

The reviews so far are really good, so I dont need to add more on the actual features.<n>You can adjust the brightness level. I lower it when I read at night in the dark.<n>You can use literature published in so many digital formats.

The advantage of the nook over a kindle is simplicity when you aren't buying a book.<n>All the books I buy are from Amazon, and so with the library it won't sync those which is unfortunate.<n>You plug it into a USB and it shows up as a drive on a computer.

After using the Nook it just makes navigation quick and awesome.<n>The e-ink screen is amazing, if you haven't tried reading on one do it.<n>The web surfing is a bit slow but I didn't buy it to surf the net, but if need be I can check email or a product.

I've never been more disappointed with an Amazon purchase and cannot understand why the B&N website doesn't point this out and neither does the Amazon website.<n>The reason I have given it four stars is because the light is not even enough on the top of the page.<n>I thought it would hurt my eyes like staring at a computer screen too long, but the ability to change the brightness eliminates that.

Great price too, compared to the others I found.<n>Works fine, but this is less than 3 dollars of electronics.<n>The screen is pretty useless unless you really need to be reminded of what button you just pressed.

Great price on this product as the big box stores charge much more for a product that really does not perform any better.<n>I'm not a videophile by any means, but the cable works, I don't see any problems with it, and it is a bunch cheaper than I could get from Best Buy.

I bought this to interface a USB-serial cable with the serial port on an 34401A DMM since this model doesn't have support. Works great so i bought two more for all DMMs in the lab Good price and good quality.

Shipping was prompt but i will say this was NOT 2 meters as said in the description, 2 meters is close the 6 feet and this was about 3 feet long.<n>Will be buying several more of these - cannot believe how well made and inexpensive this cable is.

I bought this item when I was running windows 7 and it worked fine. I am now running windows 8 I tried to use it again and it doesn't work.<n>I contacted the software provider (Honestech) their response was "The software ( VHS to DVD 3 SE) was modified by a third party (mygica.com) therefor Honestech did not support it.<n>I contacted the hardware provider they did not even have the courtesy to reply. It apparently needs a new driver but no one has.

This is a sleek looking product but it does not perform very well.<n>Could not get this to work with my Samsung Galaxy S3 and my HDMI television, so I returned the device.<n>I tried out outher converters but this one really works I can use my phone as a media device and play movies on my TV' with no WiFi connection.

The shipping packaging was great and the cable came intact.<n>The picture is not what there say for the quality.<n>I haven't tried for the 3D yet, so don't know if the label is wrong or the cable itself.

I use the cable with a Panasonic brand HDTV by inserting directly into the TV.<n>The cable has had no problems after six month's of general use.<n>The mini-hdmi connector is too delicate and was barely yanked out and broke.
Works perfectly. Couldn't beat it for the price.<n>I honestly don't understand how this cable sells for less than $3 including shipping.
I bought this cable as an alternative to the original Canon HTC-100 HDMI cable for my EOS 60D.<n>I connected it to my TV and it works fine. I can now use the TV as a large viewfinder.

i ordered a original Panasonic cable not a substitute??? and i didnot get it?<n>I guess the critical issue is that the description was accurate in that this product is compatible with my camera as indicated.
I would recommend this to all the people that I know... Good cheap long cable that actually backs up most of the capabilities, the 3-d came in a little shadowy and Ethernet signal would not either..

Maxell XLII high bias cassette tapes are highly durable, long lasting, and play back very clear sound.<n>I have used these Maxell tapes for about 15 years for everything from voice recordings to sound effects, to music.

Overall, I'm very happy with this device and consider it a very good, inexpensive alternative to having a dedicated LINE IN/LINE OUT option.<n>The great thing about this cassette adaptor is that the audio cable that leads out of it can be configured to exit from a narrow or wide side.<n>The cassette adapter itself is fairly quiet at higher volumes.
Uses a wet and dry process to clean CDs.<n>Does not need to be connected to a computer.<n>Easy to open and use.

Maxell cases are well made and reassemble easily.<n>They are available here at Amazon for a very fair price.<n>I bought two boxes of these, over 50% of them broke. Impossible to open. Don't waste your money.

I bought these for my kids to use on an airplane. I did not have high expectations, since the price was so low, but one pair had lots of static and was unusable after approximately two hours of use.<n>These sounded more'mid-rangy' to me than balanced; there's some bass but not a lot, and likewise with the treble.<n>I have a hard time recommending them for music as a result; you can certainly use them for that, as long as you're not finicky about what you listen to.

I bought these headphones at Walgreens to hold me over until I could get a nice pair of Bluetooth headphones from Amazon.<n>The audio quality is horrible -- everything sounds tinny, and they don't fit in my ears very well.<n>I have a real hard time keeping ear buds in my ears, especially when running.

I bought these at my campus store when looking for a cheap replacement for these:.<n>The sound quality is muddled together, even after they break in, and I already lost the pathetic rings of rubber that surround these.<n>Since they don't fit into your ear properly, the sound is quite "tinny", and they tend to fall out whenever I walk to classes.

Maxell cleaner takes the shape of a standard tape cassette with the usual tape replaced by the gears, felt blocks and other parts needed to convert a tape cassette into a cleaner.<n>The cleaner removes dirt and grease from the head and all the parts mounted along the entire tape path without any need to remove protective panels and doors.

Bought these at a great price & thought that high grade meant excellent quality. Not so!<n>After 1-4 uses the picture rolls on the screen and cannot be resolved with tracking controls, there are severe dropouts.<n>After 4 uses the edge was crinkled and making noise on rewind.

Out of a pack of 6, I have two that are usable for recording.<n>I agree that the images aren't as good as DVD's but they really aren't that bad.<n>I agree that the images aren't as good as DVD's but they really aren't that bad.

VCR cleaner was purchased at Amazon.com and as usual it was well packaged and received well within the promised time.<n>This VHS Wet Cleaner does clean the heads of our VCRs very nicely. Sony's waterproof shower radio comes in clear and works great in the shower.<n>The buttons (any of them) won't respond anymore though (since the last fall) and the volume just stays up high now and won't go down. LCD display goes first, then the entire player.<n>You frantically try to turn it down, but the buttons have quit working.<n>If it were a shipment of Aspirin, there would be a news alert about it.

I was looking for a tape for my older model video recorder and happen to run across this on Amazon.<n>Took a chance not really knowing if it was the right one. Got it and it was!!<n>I was quite satisfied with this product, it seemed to do everything I wanted. Keep this product so we can order it.

I received this player as a gift for Christmas in 1998.<n>Within a year, it was completely shot and would not even read or play CD's, even brand new CD's.<n>I replaced the old Sony player due to its tendancy to skip when the volume went up.

The recorder doesn't accept AC power directly.<n>It comes with an AC adapter, the type transformer attaches directly to the wall and a thin wire goes from the transformer to the recorder.<n>The only thing I would recommend is the addition of an external microphone, as the internal mic seems to be too sensitive.

Great radio for out in the barn. Seems to work great wherever you put it.<n>The only drawback I could find with this radio is the AC cord compartment is too cramped.<n>I bought it for my office at work and it is a prefect radio reception.

I bought this radio to pull in one fm station I cannot get on any other radio I have purchased.<n>This is the second ge radio bought in a number of years. we are very pleased with the quality of this radio, the best in the market.

When the stereo's not being used, the system goes into "standby" mode. The power light stays on, and there is a digital readout that says STNDBY on the display.

I bought the RT 2300 RCA home theater in a box and just love it.<n>The sound will blow you away with it's crisp, clear, Dolby digital reciever.<n>I found 300 watts total power is more than enough for any size home theater setup.

I bought this for an old camcorder I have to my niece as a 10th bday gift and these will last her along time with shooting movies lol.<n>The old camcorder worked great! I just needed some new blank tapes.

Great price and quality!<n>Had not used this old trusty cassette recorder in 20 years and cassettes were hard to locate, but easy to find here.<n>The tapes worked splendidly....I just read modules aloud into recorder as I was studying, and easily played them back off of the clock for reinforcement.

These disks look really cool with the colors and snazzy everything.<n>The sound quality on these disks is the same as on any other minidisc: they are all digital. Therefore, I don't think these are a good deal next to the $1.50 memorex sold on this site.

I love the auto wind feature and the sound quality is okay.<n>I purchased this product and found the sound quality to be very good for something in this price range.<n>The speakers hurt my ears but okay sound quality the auto wind feature was nice but not very compact I bought these headphones and after opening the packet i found they couldn't be removed from the autowinder.

The JM10's sound output is so weak, you could barely tell they are working.<n>The JM15's sound quality is immensely better than the JM10s any volume.<n>For 5 dollars this is one deal you can't beat.

These headphones have good range and sound quality (nothing phenomenal, but more than adequate).<n>Would have rated it 5 stars, but for one ergonomic issue.<n>The tuning knob on the headphone set itself (you tune it to work with the base station) is very easy to accidentally turn.

I bought this as a last ditch attempt to save my DVD-RW.<n>It worked like a charm, but the drive was unsalvagable.<n>I ejected the cleaning disk, inserted one of my CDs and voila!<n>It's entirely possible that it's just a coincidence, but my DVD player stopped working entirely after I tried to use this cleaner.

I hope it lasts longer than 30 uses, though I burn a lot of dvd's and I had notice that I was getting some freezing when I would play them back sometimes.<n>My CD player would not play at all, used this cleaner now my CD player works fine.....
Allsop is the most reputable of all Video/Audio component cleaning companies.<n>Cleans the Video and Audio Heads of your VCR.<n>Removes much more than just dust and foreign particles.

The FastWipe may leave fine scratches on the surface of the disc.<n>CD/DVD lasers like the cartridge needle of a turntable, read discs in a circular pattern, but from inside out which reads from the outer edge of a record toward the center.<n>I ordered these wipe to clean the discs without risks of scratching them...so I was totally horrified by this information.

Car CD players have a front loading mechanism as opposed to a tray or top loading.<n>If the brushes are out of alignment, as they should be after using the cleaner in the car stereo, the device will do nothing for your CD player.

This product cleaned my tape player after it being in my closet for a year and a hafe.I'd recommend it to anyone!<n>I recently purchased a shelf stereo with a cassette player so that my mom can still use her cassettes if she ever needed too and this cleaner does its job well.

I bought this hoping to fix a VCR picture issue, i had picked up a VCR recently and was hoping to clean up the picture quality.<n>I used their cleaner on my vcr when some fingerprints entered the video heads.<n>The rental vhs tape that I used apparently had some fingerprints on the tape (where you aren't supposed to touch) and infested my vcr's tape heads.

I plugged my pair of AW870's into my PowerBook G4 and have had outstanding results.<n>The sound breaks up near 150-175', more so if there are a lot of walls & obstructions.<n>The transmitter plugs right into my computer & the speakers follow me anywhere in the house so I can listen to my MP3's or the Steeler game from NFL.com every Sunday.

This boombox sounds really great for a compact unit. It has all the features one would need to use.<n>The CD player on this unit stopped working within a week of the warranty expiring.<n>This player has very poor sound quality for audio and radio play.

Easy controls, good option like a playlist, shuffle, and repeat tracks.<n>Can't ride a bike or even jog with this player.

This is a basic pc cable it works on most computers and monitors and some printers.<n>This is way cheaper here than in Walmart or another store so if you can wait for it in the mail do it will save you some extra $$$.

The SC 340 works as advertised. It is very easy to set up and use.<n>It did not control the on-screen menus on a RCA Satellite box, although it can turn the device on and off, change volume, channels, etc.

SurgeArrest model wasn't very good, which is misleading it gives you up to 8 outlets to connect your devices to.<n>It burnt out pretty quickly, and the indicator that's mean to alert you of it no longer working never was lit in the first place.<n>I particularly like about this surge protector is the feature that has two "always on' outlets.
